text:
I get an error when calling a servlet that uses log4j. To further narrow the
problem down I did the following:

- I created a log4j.properties file and some java-classes. 
- I created one class which was both a servlet and had a main method.
- I compiled my whole project and put the log4j.properties file in my
%webapp%\WEB-INF\classes directory.
- I called the class directly using java LinkGenerator from the
%webapp%\WEB-INF\classes directory and had immediate succes. Everything logged
nicely and the debug messages I wanted to see I saw.
- I used my browser to call the exact same class using:
http://localhost:8080/servlet/LinkGenerator. In my console window a message
appeared that told me that log4j hadn't been initialized properly. 

Am I in error here? Should I send this to Tomcat bugzilla instead?

Please let me know,

Martin van Dijken
creator: sunsear@raketnet.nl

text:
Martin,

This is a support request, not a bug report. Can you please direct your question
to the log4j-user list? Thank you. Ceki

text:
In the help-files on installation there's a section that specifically deals with
Tomcat and how log4j should work under it. If I read it correctly, that means
that Tomcat is supported by log4j, so how is this a support request?
